intro: Achyrocline saturejoides var. candicans, commonly known as the showy achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its foliage is aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining coastal biodiversity.
